    Plot Simultaneous Confidence Bands from CMA Output

    plot_cma.Rd

    This function visualizes the estimated mean function and simultaneous confidence bands (SCB) from a CMA result object. It supports customization of colors, line types, axis labels, and legend display.

    plot_cma(
  data,
  xlab = "Time",
  ylab = "Estimated Mean",
  line_color = "black",
  ci_color = "gray50",
  ci_linetype = "dashed",
  group_label = "Group",
  title = "Simultaneous Confidence Band",
  show_legend = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame or tibble containing the results of the cma() function. Must include columns: time, yhat, scb_low, and scb_up.

    xlab

    A character string for the x-axis label. Default is "Time".

    ylab

    A character string for the y-axis label. Default is "Estimated Mean".

    line_color

    Color for the main estimated curve (yhat). Default is "black".

    ci_color

    Color for the confidence bands (scb_low and scb_up). Default is "gray50".

    ci_linetype

    Line type for the confidence bands. Default is "dashed".

    group_label

    A character label for the color legend. Default is "Group".

    title

    A character string for the plot title. Default is "Simultaneous Confidence Band".

    show_legend

    Logical. Whether to display the legend. Default is FALSE.

    Value

    A ggplot2 object representing the confidence band plot.

    Examples

    
# example using ccds data
data(ccds)
ccds_fpca <- prepare_ccds_fpca(ccds)

fosr_mod <- mgcv::bam(percent_change ~ s(seconds, k=30, bs="cr") +
  s(seconds, by = use, k=30, bs = "cr") +
  s(subject, by = Phi1, bs="re") +
  s(subject, by = Phi2, bs="re")+
  s(subject, by = Phi3, bs="re") +
  s(subject, by = Phi4, bs="re"),
  method = "fREML", data = ccds_fpca, discrete = TRUE)

ccds_cma <- cma(ccds_fpca, fosr_mod, time = "seconds", group_name = "use", group_value = 1,
                subject = "subject")
ccds_cma <- tibble::as_tibble(ccds_cma)
plot_cma(ccds_cma, xlab = "Time (s)", ylab = "Mean",
         line_color = "blue", ci_color = "gray", ci_linetype = "dotted",
         title = "Global SCB for Treatment Group")
